(nL2TLBEntries, nDCacheTLBWays).explanation: These are independent architectural parameters that configure different components of the memory hierarchy and do not directly influence each other;

(nL2TLBEntries, nL2TLBWays).explanation: Both are independent configuration parameters of the same L2 TLB structure, where the number of entries and associativity are set independently during design;

(nL2TLBEntries, DCacheMiss).explanation: A larger L2 TLB with more entries can store more virtual-to-physical address translations, reducing TLB misses and subsequently reducing data cache misses caused by TLB miss penalties;
